source: The bonus to this ability score, based on your current choices.
The bonus to this ability score value, which you can adjust with your remaining points.
Drag and drop your rolls onto ability score cells, or auto assign.
Edit your rolls using your remaining points.
Cancels the character level up process.
Your team has one active quest.
Adds a character from your pool of local characters.
Elevate the horizontal plane by one cell.
The damage this attack causes on a successful hit.
The bonus added to d20 attack rolls with this attack.
{0} has reached the limit of {1} attunable items.
Remove attunement to this item in order to attune to a different item.
{0} has reached the attunement limit for this rest.
The number of spells of this level that you can cast. You can use one of these slots to cast a lower level spell, which may increase its effect.
Execute your action even though it is incomplete.
Click to cast a light cantrip on one of your hand-held items.
All uses of Channel Divinity are restored.
The character can perform one free/inventory action per combat round.
The character has spent the free/inventory action for this combat round.
Select any item to apply this effect.
Select an equipped item to apply this effect.
Select an unidentified magical item to identify.
Select a spellbook with at least {0} blank page(s).
Select a non-magical weapon to apply this effect.
Select a weapon to apply this effect.

The personality of a character determines how he/she will behave during narrative sequences. Some narrative flags will provide variation to dialogs, while other will open different dialog branches and more generally have the character play a role fitting his/her personality.
During character creation, the chosen background and alignment open the selection of specific personality flags, allowing you to customize the way your character behaves during narrative sequences.
The divinity that your character follows. Mandatory for some choices.
The dice cast at each level to determine your hit points, and also to recover lost hit points.
Items occupy an amount of space, and containers (backpacks, pouches) can only fit items up to a space limit.
Items all weigh something, and containers can only hold a certain weight.
Stops the crafting operation. All progress and spent ingredients are lost.
At least {0} hour(s) are required to craft this item.
The ingredients are consumed when crafting starts.
The type of ability check made by the character.
You must select one of the crafting options.
No one in the party possesses {0} type tools.
{0} is not proficient with any of the following: {1}.
At least {0} more hour(s) are required to complete this crafting operation.
The actual crafting time depends on the crafting character's ability check successes. Checks are repeated every hour until crafting is complete.
Starts the crafting operation and consumes the ingredients.
You have not learned this crafting option yet.
Closes this control panel and resumes playback.
Go back to the previous narrative state and pause the playback (shortcut: Backspace).
{0} is dying and must make a death saving throw.
{0} has died, but may be revived by party members.
{0} has died, but may be revived by party members.\n{1} expires in {2} rounds.

Add more charges to this effect.

This slot is disabled because its paired slot is equipped with a two-handed item.

Starts the battle against the enemy group.
{0} is sleeping and will not act until awoken.
{0} is aware of the approaching enemies.

Select an existing class to level up.
You are an expert at using this skill (add your proficiency bonus x 2).
You are an expert at using this type of tool (add your proficiency bonus x 2).
Click to focus the view on this character.
Display the document that details which game content uses the SRD and which is original.
Your party is currently engaged in a turn-based battle.
Opens the character view screen, from which you can access the inventory, character information, proficiencies, spells, and crafting options.
Click to give this item to {0}.
You cannot drop a quest item out of your party inventory.
Some item(s) do not fit in your inventory.
You cannot sell a quest item.
Opens the character inventory screen, from which you can also access character information, proficiencies, spells, and crafting options.
This item prevents any other item from being equipped.
You cannot carry that much weight.
This slot is locked and cannot be equipped/unequipped.
This slot is locked in battle.
Display the adventure log, listing all the events that have taken place during the campaign.
The average party level needed to fight one of these creatures in a balanced challenge.
Lists the foes you can face and the knowledge you have collected.
Your knowledge level is insufficient to access this type of information.

During your adventures you will meet people from various factions. Good relations with a faction can bring many advantages. You improve your relations with a faction by doing jobs for them or promoting their interests.
Displays the party's standing with the various factions on the Legacy Council.
Lists the active and completed quests, along with your current objectives.
Allows you to review tutorial information that was previously displayed in-game.
Find out more about Solasta on our forums.
Read about the rules system Solasta uses.

Find out more about the Solasta Universe and unique content on the online Wiki

By clicking the "I Agree" button, you accept the terms above.
By clicking the "I Do Not Agree" button, you do not accept the terms above, which means you cannot play the game.

Select and load a saved game.
Take at least eight hours to eat, drink, and sleep, and wake up ready for anything.
Loots everything from this container that can fit in your inventory without increasing your encumbrance rating.

Open the map of the location.
Detects magical auras on all items carried by party members, but does not reveal any item's function.
Your party's standing with the merchant's faction affects rebates and overcharges.
Reveals everything about a selected item, including whether it is magical.

You define your abilities using a point system. Starting each ability score at 8, you increase by one point each ability up to 13, then it will cost you two more points to increase to 14 and two more points to increase to 15 (maximum)
Your ability scores are a set of predetermined values: 15, 14, 13, 12, 10, 8
For each of your six ability scores, roll 4d6 and add together the three best results.

Thank you for playing Solasta! Click here to open the interface and leave us a review. Much love!
Your movement range is now increased, at the cost of your main action. Clicking inside your normal range will not use the dash and will preserve your main action.
Your movement range is now increased, at the cost of your bonus action. Clicking inside your normal range will not use the dash and preserve your bonus action.

Allows you to select your preferred attack cantrip for the Ready Cantrip action. If this cantrip is not usable when the readied action is triggered (out of range, for example), then another valid cantrip will be selected.
Instead of traveling to the final destination, the party will stop at the next location so that you can plot an alternate route.
